results.title: Congenital supravalvular aortic stenosis in a kitten.
results.text_hl: Recheck examination 3.5 months later revealed unchanged @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@murmur@@@ characteristics in the still asymptomatic kitten.

citations.NLM: Szatmári V. Congenital supravalvular aortic stenosis in a kitten. J Vet Cardiol. 2022 Jun;41():227-230. PMID: 35567886
citations.BibTeX: @article{35567886, title={Congenital supravalvular aortic stenosis in a kitten.}, author={Szatmári V}, journal={J Vet Cardiol}, volume={41}, pages={227-230}}

results.title: Cognitive function in hypertensives treated with atenolol or propranolol.
results.text_hl: INTERVENTIONS: Propranolol-LA, 80-mg tablets, or @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, 50-mg tablets, were given daily, incremented by one tablet at weekly intervals until @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@DBP@@@ less than or equal to 90 mmHg.

citations.NLM: Palac DM, Cornish RD, McDonald WJ, Middaugh DA, Howieson D, Bagby SP. Cognitive function in hypertensives treated with atenolol or propranolol. J Gen Intern Med. 1990 Jul-Aug;5(4):310-8. PMID: 2197376
citations.BibTeX: @article{2197376, title={Cognitive function in hypertensives treated with atenolol or propranolol.}, author={Palac DM and Cornish RD and McDonald WJ and Middaugh DA and Howieson D and Bagby SP}, journal={J Gen Intern Med}, volume={5}, number={4}, pages={310-8}}

results.title: Haemodynamic effects of atenolol, pindolol and propranolol during adrenaline infusion in man.
results.text_hl: When the subjects were pretreated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, the @CHEMICAL_Epinephrine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004837 @@@adrenaline@@@ increased SBP by 16 mm Hg, the @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@DBP@@@ did not change, HR and SV increased by 19 and 30%, and TPR fell.

citations.NLM: Rehling M, Svendsen TL, Maltbaek N, Tangø M, Trap-Jensen J. Haemodynamic effects of atenolol, pindolol and propranolol during adrenaline infusion in man. Eur J Clin Pharmacol. 1986;30(6):659-63. PMID: 3533564
citations.BibTeX: @article{3533564, title={Haemodynamic effects of atenolol, pindolol and propranolol during adrenaline infusion in man.}, author={Rehling M and Svendsen TL and Maltbaek N and Tangø M and Trap-Jensen J}, journal={Eur J Clin Pharmacol}, volume={30}, number={6}, pages={659-63}}

results.title: Lisinopril versus atenolol: decrease in systolic versus diastolic blood pressure with converting enzyme inhibition.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Lisinopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Lisinopril@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ reduced @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@SDBP@@@ to a similar extent.

citations.NLM: Pannier BE, Garabedian VG, Madonna O, Fouchard M, Darne B, Safar ME. Lisinopril versus atenolol: decrease in systolic versus diastolic blood pressure with converting enzyme inhibition. Cardiovasc Drugs Ther. 1991 Aug;5(4):775-81. PMID: 1653594

results.title: Interaction between nifedipine and atenolol: pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics in normotensive volunteers.
results.text_hl: Administration of the combination caused a significantly more pronounced @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@fall of systolic and diastolic blood pressure@@@ as compared with either drug alone, whereas the negative chronotropic effect was not different from that of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@.

citations.NLM: Rosenkranz B, Ledermann H, Frölich JC. Interaction between nifedipine and atenolol: pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics in normotensive volunteers. J Cardiovasc Pharmacol. 1986 Sep-Oct;8(5):943-9. PMID: 2429095
citations.BibTeX: @article{2429095, title={Interaction between nifedipine and atenolol: pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics in normotensive volunteers.}, author={Rosenkranz B and Ledermann H and Frölich JC}, journal={J Cardiovasc Pharmacol}, volume={8}, number={5}, pages={943-9}}

results.title: Efficacy of atenolol and oxprenolol in the treatment of arterial hypertension. A comparison.
results.text_hl: There was no statistical difference between the @DISEASE_Hypotension @DISEASE_MESH:D007022 @@@reduction of systolic blood pressure@@@ produced by the two drugs, but there was a significant difference in the reduction in @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@diastolic@@@ blood pressure in favour of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (P less than 0.05 supine; P less than 0.01 erect).

citations.NLM: Turner AS, Watson OF, Brocklehurst JE. Efficacy of atenolol and oxprenolol in the treatment of arterial hypertension. A comparison. Med J Aust. 1979 Jun 30;1(13):625-6. PMID: 386061
citations.BibTeX: @article{386061, title={Efficacy of atenolol and oxprenolol in the treatment of arterial hypertension. A comparison.}, author={Turner AS and Watson OF and Brocklehurst JE}, journal={Med J Aust}, volume={1}, number={13}, pages={625-6}}

results.title: Quality of life on antihypertensive therapy: a randomized double-blind controlled trial of captopril and atenolol.
results.text_hl: A significant fall @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@in diastolic blood pressure@@@ occurred with both @CHEMICAL_Captopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002216 @@@captopril@@@ (106.7 +/- 7.0 to 98.6 +/- 8.6 mmHg) and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (107.4 +/- 7.5 to 98.2 +/- 8.1 mmHg) but there was no difference between the two drugs in the size of the fall.

citations.NLM: Fletcher AE, Bulpitt CJ, Hawkins CM, Havinga TK, ten Berge BS, May JF, Schuurman FH, van der Veur E, Wesseling H. Quality of life on antihypertensive therapy: a randomized double-blind controlled trial of captopril and atenolol. J Hypertens. 1990 May;8(5):463-6. PMID: 2163421
citations.BibTeX: @article{2163421, title={Quality of life on antihypertensive therapy: a randomized double-blind controlled trial of captopril and atenolol.}, author={Fletcher AE and Bulpitt CJ and Hawkins CM and Havinga TK and ten Berge BS and May JF and Schuurman FH and van der Veur E and Wesseling H}, journal={J Hypertens}, volume={8}, number={5}, pages={463-6}}

results.title: Effect of atenolol on heart rate, arrhythmias, blood pressure, and dynamic left ventricular outflow tract obstruction in cats with subclinical hypertrophic cardiomyopathy.
results.text_hl: @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@Murmur@@@ grade decreased after @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ from a median grade of 3/6 to 2/6 (p < 0.0001).

citations.NLM: Jackson BL, Adin DB, Lehmkuhl LB. Effect of atenolol on heart rate, arrhythmias, blood pressure, and dynamic left ventricular outflow tract obstruction in cats with subclinical hypertrophic cardiomyopathy. J Vet Cardiol. 2015 Dec;17 Suppl 1():S296-305. PMID: 26776587

results.title: [Efficacy and tolerability of a cardioselective beta-blocking drug (atenolol) in the treatment of essential hypertension. A double blind study (author's transl)].
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ significantly reduced @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@systolic and diastolic blood pressure@@@ in recumbent and standing position and heart rate at rest.

citations.NLM: Rengo F, Trimarco B, Petretta M, Ferrara N, Bonaduce D, Chiariello M, Condorelli M. [Efficacy and tolerability of a cardioselective beta-blocking drug (atenolol) in the treatment of essential hypertension. A double blind study (author's transl)]. G Ital Cardiol. 1978;8(8):861-7. PMID: 359398

results.title: A double-blind comparison of metoprolol CR/ZOK 50 mg and atenolol 50 mg once daily for uncomplicated hypertension.
results.text_hl: In an evaluation of the responder rate after the 8 weeks of treatment, 89% of the @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ in the metoprolol CR/ZOK group and 74% in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ group (P less than .05) had a @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Murmurs</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006337 @@@diastolic blood pressure reduction@@@ to 90 mmHg or less.

citations.NLM: Klein G, Berger J, Olsson G, Menzel T. A double-blind comparison of metoprolol CR/ZOK 50 mg and atenolol 50 mg once daily for uncomplicated hypertension. J Clin Pharmacol. 1990 Feb;30(S2):S72-7. PMID: 2179284
citations.BibTeX: @article{2179284, title={A double-blind comparison of metoprolol CR/ZOK 50 mg and atenolol 50 mg once daily for uncomplicated hypertension.}, author={Klein G and Berger J and Olsson G and Menzel T}, journal={J Clin Pharmacol}, volume={30}, number={S2}, pages={S72-7}}
